hotspots.label: Bright Yellow Color
hotspots.fact: This fungus is bright yellow because of special pigments in its cells. The vibrant color helps scientists identify different types of fungi in nature.

hotspots.label: Spongy Texture
hotspots.fact: This fungus has a bumpy, spongy texture that feels gelatinous or rubbery. This unusual structure helps the fungus absorb water and nutrients from decaying wood.

hotspots.label: Decaying Wood Home
hotspots.fact: This fungus grows on dead wood and leaves on the forest floor. Fungi are nature's recyclers—they break down dead plants and return nutrients to the soil.

hotspots.label: Fungal Growth Pattern
hotspots.fact: Notice how the fungus grows in different shapes and sizes! This is called the fruiting body, and it's how the fungus releases spores to create new fungus elsewhere.
